TopicTitle: Curse, just another program to have running always

Articles.Content:
Thanks, now if I want to mod I will have to have curse running, alongside, Origin, Steam, and Raptr.

Seriously, why do game devs keep requiring extra programs to be ran?

Actually you don't need it at all, and it currently does not support KSP anyway.

Just download the addons from curseforge, as if it were any other download site, there's no ads or timers on curseforge by the way

Look in the top left corner, you'll see the KSP icon.

Underneath that is a links bar.

4th one from the left is MODS. Click that.

New page opens. Find mods. Download mods.

I think if the new Curse client is ad-less as promised and allows automatic checks for updates to my mods, I'll be installing it. I find even my modest mod list of a dozen mods difficult to keep up to date, especially after a core game update drops. I can only imagine how tedious it is for those with much longer mod lists.

Here's a little protip for you:

Kill the processes for Origin, Steam, and Raptr (and Curse, if you bother to download the client which I won't) when you're not using them. You don't need Steam to play KSP. Or Curse.

You also don't need to download the Ask Toolbar to use Java.
